source.f54d4136:
# WHAT WILL WE DO IN THIS NOTEBOOK

This year's challenge will focus on models to determine whether a patient admitted to an ICU has been diagnosed with a particular type of diabetes, Diabetes Mellitus. Using data from the first 24 hours of intensive care, individuals and teams will explore labeled training data for model development.

source.8d46d999:
### Conclusion
*  The patients in ICU is heavily dominated by Caucasian , and not even close, Causasian are in very high percentage 
* Caucasians who are in ICU, most of them do not have diabetes
* Hispanic people have reltively higher chance of being diabeteic
* Most of the Caucasians in icu are relatively of elder age (60-80) while NATIVE AMERICANS are youngest out of all ethnicites to be in ICU 
* Asians have lowest BMI while Native Americns have highest BMI
source.4a7db31e:
* Majority of people that are in ICU due to any illness are OBESE 
* It is a very good probability that obese person would have diabetese
* Females tend to more obese and have higher chance of having diabetes
* Even people who are in ICU and do not have diabetes , women have more change of being obese

source.d3c182d5:
* Most of the patients are between 60 and 80 especially very high at between 65 and 70
* Elder people have a great chance of having diabetes and interestingly both women and men with diabetes are almost in same age group
* BMI varies with age almost like normal curve , but there is a sharp decrease at 65ish and now see the first point , co incidence , i guess not !!
* Woment aroung age of 65ish have a very high probabilty of having diabetes as evident by second plot
*  As most of the patient are from 65ish age group and women are more in that age group of patients so women at this age group must need extra medical attention
* BMI of women are higher than male throughout their lives but at 65ish something there is sudden fall which is quite weird
